Snapshot: Beekeeping contributes billions worldwide. Honey production alone exceeds 1.6 million tonnes annually, with China, Turkey, and Iran as leaders.
Supply & Demand: Honey flows vary seasonally and geographically. Imports fill gaps in the UK, while premium single-flower honeys attract high margins.
Revenue Streams: Beekeepers profit from honey, wax, pollination contracts, queen rearing, and nucleus colony sales. In the US, pollination of almonds is the single biggest earner.
Risks & Compliance: Fraudulent honey adulteration, pesticide kills, and disease outbreaks all affect income. Insurance, contracts, and traceability reduce risk.
